item.description:
Make your own journal with found papers, and learn two types of bindings!  We'll be sharing lots of fun papers:  old book pages, sheet music, ledger paper, maps, wallpaper samples and hand-painted/decorated papers.  And we'll show you how to create signatures (book sections), make a booklet with pamphlet stitch, or bind a larger journal with coptic stitch.  Join us for a relaxed afternoon of creativity, and go home with at least one new journal, ready to be filled with your own inspiration, art and musings.

 

DAY/TIME: Saturday, June 4, from 1:00 pm to ???? (Really, we'll stay as late as anybody wants to stay!) Come for an hour or two; come for the whole afternoon and into the evening.

AMENITIES: Free parking. Table space and a chair. Access to some tools (paper cutter, heat gun, etc.). Access to a fridge, microwave, toaster oven, kitchen sink and restroom. Dinner in or out, if people are interested.

COST: $18 to help defray the cost of Studio rental and provided materials.

WHO MAY ATTEND: Any member of the NE ATC+ Meetup and up to two guests.

HOW TO SIGN UP: These smaller sessions are often full with a waiting list. Reserve a place by RSVP-ing "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. Please RSVP for your guests as well.

If your plans (or your guests' plans) change, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly. Please do this right up to the start time of the event.  

WHAT TO BRING:  Your own art kit (scissors, glue sticks, ruler, pencil, pens and markers) will be good to have along. (Optional) All materials will be provided for one or two journals, but please feel free to bring any papers you'd like to use and/or share. We'll have at least 2 guillotine paper cutters, but if you have this or some other type of paper trimmer please try to bring it — we'll be cutting a lot of paper. You can also bring along any particular image or artwork you'd like to use as a cover for your journal. But basic tools and supplies -- scissors, glue, tape, blank ATCS, etc. -- are also available for your use. Even if you show up empty-handed, we can get you started on the project. 

CANCELLATIONS: In the unlikely event that we need to cancel---or even if we're just getting a late start--we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail everyone who's RSVP'd "yes." So to be on the safe side, please check the Web site and your inbox before departing for ArtStudio 36

group.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

item.name: "Found Papers (aka "Poor Man's") Journal"
